learning_outcomes.description: Capably enact at the level of a graduate registered midwife/nurse the key requirements for professional practice defined by Nursing and Midwifery Board of Australia’s Professional Standards.

Effectively plan, implement and evaluate midwifery/nursing care for a full workload that respects and acknowledges the values of women, individuals and their family of different cultures and backgrounds, while maintaining the principles of confidentiality and applies an evidence-based practice framework.
Demonstrate and consolidate effective time management, clinical reasoning and professional judgement to deliver woman and person-centred care, that can be utilised in global environments.

Utilise effective communication and beginning leadership skills to inform, educate and empower women, individuals, their family and colleagues towards safe and expected healthcare outcomes for the individual.

Apply reflective practice to identify goals and self-evaluate progress in ongoing resilience and professional development, appropriately selecting and utilising healthcare evidence and feedback to ensure capability for practice.

assessments.due_date: To be completed by week 6 of your clinical placement.
assessments.category: Notebook/ Logbook, Performance, Placement, Portfolio, Quiz, Reflection
assessments.task_description:
This assessment task comprises of three (3) parts, which will examine and extend your preparedness for clinical placement.

Part 1 – Medication safety

This assessment comprises of two (2) parts and requires the student to undertake 1) online assessments on medication drug calculations and 2) completion of a clinical case study.

To pass this assessment students must achieve 100% in both assessment tasks and is to be completed by Friday of Week one (1) of commencement of clinical practice.

Part 2 - Demonstration of knowledge and reflective practice through Observed Clinical Practice and Feedback submissions.

Choose and complete two (2) skills from different domains at a final year level (midway through placement).

Part 3 - Demonstrated capability in clinical practice commensurate with NUMW3204 Course Learning Outcomes evidenced by completion and submission of the Australian Midwifery Standards Assessment Tool (AMSAT).

Submission of your signed Mid-Point AMSAT with skills to be completed via your ePAD. 

  • Please access the task description in the Blackboard site for more detailed information.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Students are required to upload their completed Medsafe certificates to the companion Blackboard site under Assessments (clicking on submission link).
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: You will receive a mark of 0 if this assessment is submitted late.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.due_date:
To be completed by week 13 of your clinical placement.

All requirements must be completed and met to fulfil this assessment which contributes to passing the course.

This assessment is pass or fail so late submissions without an extension will be given zero marks resulting in a fail grade.
assessments.category: Notebook/ Logbook, Performance, Placement, Portfolio, Reflection
assessments.task_description:
This final assessment requires you to demonstrate successful completion of clinical placement. There are three (3) parts to this assessment:

Part 1 - Demonstration of knowledge and reflective practice through the Observed Clinical Practice and Feedback submissions.

Choose and complete three (3) skills from different domains at a final year level (midway through placement).

Part 2 - Completion and upload of Midwifery Practice Experiences in real time.

Part 3 - Demonstrated capability in clinical practice commensurate with the Course Learning Outcomes evidenced by completion and submission of the Australian Midwifery Standards Assessment Tool (AMSAT).

Submission of your signed Final AMSAT with remaining skills to be completed via your ePAD. 

  • Please access the task description in the Blackboard site for more detailed information.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Students are required to upload their completed skills, MPE, CoCE, and AMSAT to the ePAD.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: You will receive a mark of 0 if this assessment is submitted late.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 18(23 Jun - 02 Nov)
learning_activities.topic:
Clinical practice

Clinical practice attendance at your allocated clinical practice hospital requires the completion of 360 hours of clinical practice and is COMPULSORY. Dates for commencement and completion of placement are based on your clinical placement site, so may begin before Week 1 of the semester.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Clinical practice Clinical practice attendance at your allocated clinical practice hospital requires the completion of 360 hours of clinical practice and is COMPULSORY . Dates for commencement and completion of placement are based on your clinical placement site, so may begin before Week 1 of the semester.
